entry.title: Preparing for your first day at a new tech job (emotionally, mentally, and professionally)

media:group.media:title: Preparing for your first day at a new tech job (emotionally, mentally, and professionally)
media:group.media:description:
Thank you to Formation for partnering with me on this video! Formation is an online fellowship helping early career software engineers break into top tier companies like Google, Dropbox and Lyft. Every Fellowship is custom tailored to each Fellow's specific career goals and incoming skill levels so that our mentorship and training is targeting the Fellow's specific skill gaps. All Fellows are supported unconditionally until they have a signed offer letter, with ongoing feedback and mentorship from senior engineers from the top companies in the world. Find out more here: https://formation.dev/mayuko

entry.title: Why Silicon Valley isn't necessarily the best place for a Tech Career

media:group.media:title: Why Silicon Valley isn't necessarily the best place for a Tech Career
media:group.media:description:
Thank you to Formation for partnering with me on this video! Formation is an online fellowship helping early career software engineers break into top tier companies like Google, Dropbox and Lyft. Every Fellowship is custom tailored to each Fellow's specific career goals and incoming skill levels so that our mentorship and training is targeting the Fellow's specific skill gaps. All Fellows are supported unconditionally until they have a signed offer letter, with ongoing feedback and mentorship from senior engineers from the top companies in the world. Find out more here: https://fm.dev/88v
Thank you again to the guests on this episode! Buster Benson Kate Finlay Shawn Krisman Philip Su Daniel Tomko Adam Wolff

Today we have Maya on Mukoâ€™s Corner! Maya is a software engineer, content creator, and speaker who aims to inspire more people to get into tech. Sheâ€™s worked as a full-stack software engineer at companies like Intuit and Slack, where sheâ€™s built features used by millions. Also known as Maya Loves Code, she has amassed over a million views across her various social media platforms, where she creates content about tech, software engineering, and her life. Maya has been featured in Khan Academy, Go Daddy Proâ€™s Documentary Series, and has been a co-host for Amazon Web Services. You can find out more about her at @MayaBello
